hero.docs: The Training API is a practice RESTful API that anyone can use to learn how to work with APIs. It includes all the necessary details you will need for future API integrations in various projects. It is available to everyone. The API has its own API documentation and you can also use the ready-made Postman collection.

docs_intro.title: Introduction
docs_intro.description: Documentation helps you understand API operation principles and guides you through the integration process. The API is organized by topics, where you can find all requests related to this topic. Please note that the requests marked with a 'lock' symbol require authorization (with a Bearer Token obtained by the user when logging into the system). Also, in the examples of the given objects, all required fields are highlighted in bold. If all fields are in black text, it is optional. The API supports two languages, English (en) and Georgian (ka). To change the language, the Accept-Language header in the request must include the corresponding language code (en, ka).

docs.required_color: Required fields are marked with green color
docs.bad_request: Some error not related to the exact key

user.title: User
user.feed_desc: You can retrieve posts from the feed using the principle of pagination. In the request, you can include the page and perPage parameters, which allow you to receive the desired pagination. Also, you can directly send a request to /post/feed, where in this case, page will be 1, and perPage will be 15.
user.login_description: After user authorization you will receive access token, which you can use to access other API endpoints. Access token should be passed in Authorization header as Bearer token. Also, you can use refresh token to get new access token after it expires. Expiration time is included in response.
user.refresh_description: After access token expires, you can use refresh token to get new access token. Refresh token should be passed in Authorization header as Bearer token.

post.title: Post
post.feed_desc: You can retrieve the posts feed using the pagination principle. In the request, you can include the page and perPage parameters, which will give you the desired pagination. You can also send the request directly to /post/feed, in which case page will be 1 and perPage will be 15.
